sn56.21:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Vajjians at the village of Koṭi.
sn56.21:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn56.21:4.3: “Mendicants, not understanding and not penetrating four things, both you and I have wandered and transmigrated for such a very long time.
sn56.21:5.5: and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.21:5.6: These noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path have been understood and penetrated. Craving to be reborn has been cut off; the attachment to being reborn is ended; now there are no more future lives.”
sn56.21:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn56.21:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn56.21:7.3: we have transmigrated for a long time
sn56.21:7.4: from one rebirth to the next.
sn56.21:8.1: But now that these truths have been seen,
sn56.21:8.2: the attachment to being reborn is undone.
sn56.21:8.3: The root of suffering is cut off,
sn56.21:8.4: now there are no more future lives.”
